ygData.subject: Re: Fire Fingers
ygData.msgSnippet: Do not cast your spells first.  Allow you tanks to beat on it for a bit, you can get in there and swing away too...just let the tanks hit it for 3-5 rounds
ygData.messageBody:
Do not cast your spells first. Allow you tanks to beat on it for a bit, you
can get in there and swing away too...just let the tanks hit it for 3-5
rounds (unless they are getting beat up bad). After that, cast away...be
mana conservative. Dont cast every drop of mana you have if your party is
fairing well against the MOBs. Save your mana to save your party's ass when
it comes to do or die time....then you are the hero and they realize why we
have wizards in the game.

- Ziffnab

-----Original Message-----
From: McCartney, Michael R [mailto:Michael.McCartney2@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 4:27 PM
To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com'
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Fire Fingers


From: "McCartney, Michael R" <Michael.McCartney2@...>

Its an awesome spell as a joke. You can run up to parties that are fighting
groups of monsters.. cast this spell a couple of times, and they'll kill
you. Oh, wait. Nevermind. Its useless. =)

> ----------

> Reply To: eq_wizards@onelist.com

> Subject: [eq_wizards] Fire Fingers

> What good is this spell... I have never seen the damage on it so on that I
> cannot comment. However, if wizards are never suppose to tank... what
good
> is a PB area effect spell? It is tough enough having every monster in an
> area attack you when you area effect spell them at range... much less at
PB.
> Will some one give me some insight into this spell and others like it (PB
> area damage)?
>
> Rutreeii
